member.summary: this public class represents a file within the GpxFileSystem

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem
member.summary: This public class represents the file system structure stored within a GPX container file.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.FileFilter
member.summary: You can set a file filter method using this setter. On parsing the filestructure this function can determine based on the filename whether this file will be available after loading. This way we can reduce the amount of memory we store.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.Files
member.summary: Gets the list of files stored in this FileSystem.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new GpxFileSystem instance

member.summary: Load a complete FileSystem to the memory.
member.param: the binary source to read from.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.ReadHeader(AlphaTab.IO.BitReader)
member.summary: Reads the 4 byte header as a string.
member.param: the BitInput to read from
member.returns: a string with 4 characters representing the header.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.Decompress(AlphaTab.IO.BitReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decompresses the given bitinput using the GPX compression format. Only use this method if you are sure the binary data is compressed using the GPX format. Otherwise unexpected behavior can occure.
member.param: the bitInput to read the data from
true if the header should NOT be included in the result byteset, otherwise false
member.returns: the decompressed byte data. if skipHeader is set to false the BCFS header is included.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.ReadBlock(AlphaTab.IO.BitReader)
member.summary: Reads a block from the given data source.
member.param: the data source

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.ReadUncompressedBlock(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads an uncompressed data block into the model.
member.param: the data store to read from.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.GetString(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a zeroterminated ascii string from the given source
member.param: the data source to read from
the offset to start reading from
the max length to read
member.returns: the ascii string read from the datasource.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.GetInteger(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads an 4 byte signed integer from the given source
member.param: the data source to read from
offset the offset to start reading from

member.summary: Indicates the first fret of the chord diagram.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of frets where the finger should hold a barre

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.ModelUtils
member.summary: This public class contains some utilities for working with model public classes

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode
member.summary: Lists the modes how accidentals are handled for notes

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.Default
member.summary: Accidentals are calculated automatically.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.SwapAccidentals
member.summary: If the default behavior calculates a Sharp, use flat instead (and vice versa).

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceNatural
member.summary: This will move the note one line down and applies a Naturalize.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceSharp
member.summary: This will move the note one line down and applies a Sharp.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceFlat
member.summary: This will move the note one line up and applies a Flat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Note
member.summary: A note is a single played sound on a fretted instrument. It consists of a fret offset and a string on which the note is played on. It also can be modified by a lot of different effects.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.Note.GlobalNoteId
member.summary: This is a global counter for all notes. We use it at several locations for lookup tables.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.String
member.summary: Gets or sets the string number where the note is placed. 1 is the lowest string on the guitar and the bottom line on the tablature. It then increases the the number of strings on available on the track.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.PickStrokeType
member.summary: Lists all types of pick strokes.

member.summary: This public class stores the midi specific information of a track needed for playback.

member.summary: All masterbars repeated within this group

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.Openings
member.summary: a list of masterbars which open the group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.Closings
member.summary: a list of masterbars which close the group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.IsClosed
member.summary: true if the repeat group was closed well

member.summary: The score is the root node of the complete model. It stores the basic information of a song and stores the sub components.

member.summary: The album of this song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Artist
member.summary: The artist who performs this song.

member.summary: The owner of the copyright of this song.

member.summary: The title of the song.

member.summary: The author of the song lyrics

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Tab
member.summary: The author of this tablature.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Section
member.summary: This public class is used to describe the beginning of a section within a song. It acts like a marker.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.SlideType
member.summary: This public enum lists all different types of finger slides on a string.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Staff
member.summary: This class describes a single staff within a track. There are instruments like pianos where a single track can contain multiple staffs.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Track
member.summary: This public class describes a single track or instrument of score

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Track.TranspositionPitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of semitones this track should be transposed. This applies to rendering and playback.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Track.DisplayTranspositionPitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of semitones this track should be transposed. This applies only to rendering.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Track.Tuning
member.summary: Get or set the guitar tuning of the guitar. This tuning also indicates the number of strings shown in the guitar tablature. Unlike the property this array directly represents the order of the tracks shown in the tablature. The first item is the most top tablature line.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.TripletFeel
member.summary: This public enumeration lists all feels of triplets.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Tuning
member.summary: This public class represents a predefined string tuning.

members.member: Checks if the given string is a tuning inticator. Checks if the given string is a tuning inticator.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.VibratoType
member.summary: This public enum lists all vibrato types that can be performed.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Voice
member.summary: A voice represents a group of beats that can be played during a bar.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase
member.summary: This is the base public class for creating blocks which can render bars.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.IsLinkedToPrevious
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this renderer is linked to the next one by some glyphs like a vibrato effect

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.TopPadding
member.summary: Gets the top padding for the main content of the renderer. Can be used to specify where i.E. the score lines of the notation start.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.BottomPadding
member.summary: Gets the bottom padding for the main content of the renderer. Can be used to specify where i.E. the score lines of the notation end.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition
member.summary: Lists the different position modes for

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.PreNotes
member.summary: Gets the pre-notes position which is located before the accidentals

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.OnNotes
member.summary: Gets the on-notes position which is located after the accidentals but before the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.PostNotes
member.summary: Get the post-notes position which is located at after the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.EndBeat
member.summary: Get the end-beat position which is located at the end of the beat. This position is almost equal to the pre-notes position of the next beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererFactory
member.summary: This is the base public class for creating factories providing BarRenderers

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing
member.summary: Lists all sizing types of the effect bar glyphs

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SinglePreBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the pre-beat glyph which is before the actual note in the area where also accidentals are renderered.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SingleOnBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph which is where the actual note head glyphs are placed.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedBeforeBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedOnBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.FullBar
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed on the whole bar covering the whole width

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarRenderer
member.summary: This renderer is responsible for displaying effects above or below the other staves like the vibrato.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph
member.summary: Effect-Glyphs implementing this public interface get notified as they are expanded over multiple beats.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.Beat
member.summary: Gets or sets the beat where the glyph belongs to.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.NextGlyph
member.summary: Gets or sets the next glyph of the same type in case the effect glyph is expanded when using .

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.PreviousGlyph
member.summary: Gets or sets the previous glyph of the same type in case the effect glyph is expanded when using .

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.Glyph
member.summary: A glyph is a single symbol which can be added to a GlyphBarRenderer for automated layouting and drawing of stacked symbols.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GlyphGroup
member.summary: This glyph allows to group several other glyphs to be drawn at the same x position

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GroupedEffectGlyph.IsLinkedWithPrevious
member.summary: Gets a value whether this glyph is linked with a previous glyph for rendering. This means this glyph will not be rendered itself, but rendered as part of the very first glyph of this link-group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GroupedEffectGlyph.IsLinkedWithNext
member.summary: Gets a value whether this glyph is linked with the next glyph for rendering.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.SpacingGlyph
member.summary: This simple glyph allows to put an empty region in to a BarRenderer.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.TieGlyph.PaintTie(AlphaTab.Platform.ICanvas,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: paints a tie between the two given points

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.VoiceContainerGlyph
member.summary: This glyph acts as container for handling multiple voice rendering

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo
member.summary: A public class implementing this public interface can provide the data needed by a EffectBarRenderer to create effect glyphs dynamically.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.EffectId
member.summary: Gets the unique effect name for this effect. (Used for grouping)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CanShareBand
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect can share the space with other effects if required. (Example: tempo and dynamics don't share their space with other effects, a let-ring and palm-mute will share the space if possible)
member.returns: true if this effect bar should only be created once for the first track, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.HideOnMultiTrack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect glyphs should only be added once on the first track if multiple tracks are rendered. (Example: this allows to render the tempo changes only once)
member.returns: true if this effect bar should only be created once for the first track, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.ShouldCreateGlyph(AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether the given beat has the appropriate effect set and needs a glyph creation
member.param: the beat storing the data
member.returns: true if the beat has the effect set, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.SizingMode
member.summary: Gets the sizing mode of the glyphs created by this info.
member.returns: the sizing mode to apply to the glyphs during layout

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CreateNewGlyph(AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Creates a new effect glyph for the given beat.
member.param: the renderer which requests for glyph creation
the beat storing the data
member.returns: the glyph which needs to be added to the renderer

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CanExpand(AlphaTab.Model.Beat,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether an effect glyph can be expanded to a particular beat.
member.param: the beat which already has the glyph applied
the beat which the glyph should get expanded to
member.returns: true if the glyph can be expanded, false if a new glyph needs to be created.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements
member.summary: A list of the elements which can be shown in the header and footer of a rendered song sheet. All values can be combined using bit-operators as they are flags.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.None
member.summary: No elements get rendered.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Title
member.summary: Enables rendering of the title.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.SubTitle
member.summary: Enables rendering of the subtitle.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Artist
member.summary: Enables rendering of the artist.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Album
member.summary: Enables rendering of the album.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Words
member.summary: Enables rendering of the words.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Music
member.summary: Enables rendering of the music.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.WordsAndMusic
member.summary: Enables rendering of the words and music.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Copyright
member.summary: Enables rendering of the copyright.

member.summary: This is the main wrapper of the rendering engine which can render a single track of a score object into a notation sheet.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.BarLayoutingInfo
member.summary: This public class stores size information about a stave. It is used by the layout engine to collect the sizes of score parts to align the parts across multiple staves.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.BarLayoutingInfo.Version
member.summary: an internal version number that increments whenever a change was made.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.MasterBarsRenderers
member.summary: This container represents a single column of bar renderers independent from any staves. This container can be used to reorganize renderers into a new staves.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff
member.summary: A Staff represents a single line within a StaveGroup. It stores BarRenderer instances created from a given factory.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.TrackIndex
member.summary: This is the index of the track being rendered. This is not the index of the track within the model, but the n-th track being rendered. It is the index of the array defining which tracks should be rendered. For single-track rendering this will always be zero.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.StaveTop
member.summary: This is the visual offset from top where the Staff contents actually start. Used for grouping using a accolade

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.StaveBottom
member.summary: This is the visual offset from top where the Staff contents actually ends. Used for grouping using a accolade

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup
member.summary: A Staff consists of a list of different staves and groups them using an accolade.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup.IsFull
member.summary: Indicates whether this line is full or not. If the line is full the bars can be aligned to the maximum width. If the line is not full the bars will not get stretched.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup.Width
member.summary: The width that the content bars actually need

member.summary: a lookup list containing an info whether the notes within an octave need an accidental rendered. the accidental symbol is determined based on the type of key signature.

member.summary: Contains the list of notes within an octave have accidentals set.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.StepsPerOctave
member.summary: We always have 7 steps per octave. (by a step the offsets inbetween score lines is meant, 0 steps is on the first line (counting from top) 1 steps is on the space inbetween the first and the second line

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.OctaveSteps
member.summary: Those are the amount of steps for the different clefs in case of a note value 0 [Neutral, C3, C4, F4, G2]

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.SharpNoteSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of the notes within an octave in case of for sharp keysignatures

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.FlatNoteSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of the notes within an octave in case of for flat keysignatures

member.summary: Calculates the accidental for the given note and assignes the value to it. The new accidental type is also registered within the current scope

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Settings
member.summary: This public class contains instance specific settings for alphaTab
This public class contains instance specific settings for alphaTab

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Scale
member.summary: Sets the zoom level of the rendered notation

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Width
member.summary: The initial size of the canvas during loading or the width for particular layouts (e.g. page layout).

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Engine
member.summary:
The engine which should be used to render the the tablature.
default - Platform specific default engine
html5 - HTML5 Canvas
svg - SVG

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Layout
member.summary: The layout specific settings

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.StretchForce
member.summary: The default stretch force to use for layouting.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ForcePianoFingering
member.summary: Forces the fingering rendering to use always the piano finger stle where fingers are rendered as 1-5 instead of p,i,m,a,c and T,1,2,3,4.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Staves
member.summary: The staves that should be shown in the music sheet. This is one of the profiles registered in the

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.TranspositionPitches
member.summary: The transposition pitch offsets for the individual tracks. They apply to rendering and playback.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.DisplayTranspositionPitches
member.summary: The transposition pitch offsets for the individual tracks. They apply to rendering only.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.LayoutSettings.Mode
member.summary:
The layouting mode used to arrange the the notation.
page - Bars are aligned in rows using a fixed width
horizontal - Bars are aligned horizontally in one row

member.name: P:AlphaTab.LayoutSettings.AdditionalSettings
member.summary:
Additional layout mode specific settings. mode=page
barsPerRow - Limit the displayed bars per row, -1 for sized based limit (integer, default:-1)
start - The bar start index to start layouting with (integer: default: 0)
count - The amount of bars to render overall, -1 for all till the end (integer, default:-1)
hideInfo - Render the song information or not (boolean, default:false)
hideTuning - Render the tuning information or not (boolean, default:false)
hideTrackNames - Render the track names or not (boolean, default:false)
mode=horizontal
start - The bar start index to start layouting with (integer: default: 0)
count - The amount of bars to render overall, -1 for all till the end (integer, default:-1)
hideTrackNames - Render the track names or not (boolean, default:false)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.StaveSettings.Id
member.summary:
The stave profile name as it is registered in Default Profiles:
score-tab - Standard music notation and guitar tablature are rendered (default)
score - Only standard music notation is rendered
tab - Only guitar tablature is rendered

member.name: P:AlphaTab.StaveSettings.AdditionalSettings
member.summary:
Additional stave sspecific settings id=tab
rhythm - Renders rhythm beams to tablature notes

member.summary: faster than enum
